materials.raw_text: Neodymium (Nd): 11.5 g, Ruthenium (Ru): 4.0 g, Indium (In): 9.0 g

sourcing.instructions: Neodymium: Purchase from a rare earth metal supplier or online marketplace. Ruthenium: Available from precious metal suppliers or chemical supply companies. Indium: Obtain from electronic component suppliers or metal vendors.
steps: Neodymium: Purchase from a rare earth metal supplier or online marketplace. Ruthenium: Available from precious metal suppliers or chemical supply companies. Indium: Obtain from electronic component suppliers or metal vendors.

1. Weigh out 11.5 g of Neodymium using a precision scale. 2. Weigh out 4.0 g of Ruthenium. 3. Weigh out 9.0 g of Indium. 4. Combine the weighed elements in a clean, dry crucible. 5. Stir the mixture thoroughly to ensure uniform distribution of materials.
preparation.raw_text: 1. Weigh out 11.5 g of Neodymium using a precision scale. 2. Weigh out 4.0 g of Ruthenium. 3. Weigh out 9.0 g of Indium. 4. Combine the weighed elements in a clean, dry crucible. 5. Stir the mixture thoroughly to ensure uniform distribution of materials.

steps: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Set the furnace to 1200°C. 3. Allow the mixture to heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the metals.
heating.raw_text: 1. Place the crucible in a high-temperature furnace. 2. Set the furnace to 1200°C. 3. Allow the mixture to heat for 2 hours to ensure complete melting and mixing of the metals.

steps: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to 800°C. 2. Once at 800°C, remove the crucible carefully using heat-resistant gloves. 3. Place the crucible on a heat-resistant surface and allow it to cool to room temperature over a duration of 4 hours.
cooling.raw_text: 1. Turn off the furnace and allow it to cool down to 800°C. 2. Once at 800°C, remove the crucible carefully using heat-resistant gloves. 3. Place the crucible on a heat-resistant surface and allow it to cool to room temperature over a duration of 4 hours.

steps: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect the sample for surface imperfections and use sandpaper (grit 400) to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to the surface to enhance durability and finish.
post_processing.raw_text: 1. Once cooled, remove the solid sample from the crucible. 2. Inspect the sample for surface imperfections and use sandpaper (grit 400) to smooth out any rough edges. 3. Optionally, apply a protective sealant to the surface to enhance durability and finish.
